Wrath of the Flameborn.name: 焚世者之怒
Wrath of the Flameborn.description:
焚世者伏尔卡萨已彻底成长为成年红龙，并陷入仇恨与复仇的狂暴。冒险者们曾阻挠其仪式的行径必将招致清算。如今，焦翼遮蔽苍穹的赤色巨影在诸邦肆虐——村庄化作火湖，商队成灰烬，军事哨所仅余熔融铁骸。零星幸存者颤抖着描述恶龙可怖的焚世者之怒：巨龙总在将受害者焚为焦炭前，逼问某支冒险者小队的踪迹。

昔日蛰伏巢穴的阴影已然褪去，伏尔卡萨展开遮天双翼巡狩天际。当龙焰开始舔舐城墙垛口，恐慌如野火般在城邦间蔓延。诸邦领主向冒险者们下达最终敕令：要么终结这场浩劫，要么背负渎神之罪被放逐至焦土边境。熔金竖瞳的凝视下，每声心跳都在助长龙威。

炽风掠过枯焦原野，龙鳞缝隙淌落的岩浆在大地刻写着末日的来临。冒险者们能否在焚世者将珍视的一切化为焦土前，用剑与咒文谱写属于自己的传奇终章？

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

The adventure is designed for a group of 4 player characters of levels 12 to 15 but can be adjusted for other levels.

The easiest way to adjust the difficulty of the encounters is by changing the hit points, armor or the damage of the monsters.

BACKGROUND.name: BACKGROUND
BACKGROUND.text:
Months ago, the adventurers tried to stop Volcathar, a young red dragon, from completing a dark ritual that would transform him into an adult. Though weakened by the ritual's interruption, Volcathar escaped into the molten caverns of his lair to rest and recover.

Transformed into a fearsome adult dragon, his power has fully matured, and his thirst for vengeance burns hotter than ever. Driven by hatred, the dragon has taken flight to track down the party. His only desire is to find them and burn them to ashes.

Word begins to spread that a dragon has been spotted flying across the land, leaving a trail of devastation in its wake. Villages, caravans, and outposts have been attacked, reduced to ruins. Survivors, few and traumatized, describe a monstrous red dragon with its scales covered in flames. Witnesses recount how the dragon interrogates its victims before incinerating them, demanding to know the whereabouts of a particular group of adventurers.

Lava (Optional Rules)

Touching Lava (brief contact):

  • If a creature touches lava briefly (e.g., a hand or foot grazes it), they take 10d10 fire damage. This would represent a quick contact or splash of lava.

Falling into Lava (submerged):

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: ADVENTURE HOOKS
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text: A string of settlements, trade posts, and isolated outposts have been annihilated. Authorities suspect the attacks are connected to the adventurers, as witnesses report the dragon asking specifically for them. Fearing that their home base will be the dragon's next target, a regional lord commands the party to deal with the menace or face banishment, being blamed for bringing this catastrophe upon the region.

MAPS.name: MAPS
MAPS.text:
Town Square

The town square is a bustling scene of daily life, with market stalls full of fresh produce and local merchants hawking their wares. The central fountain gently trickles, providing a calming ambiance as the party goes about their business. There is no warning, no hint of danger until it's too late.

Without warning, a shadow looms over the square. Townsfolk glance up in confusion, their faces turning to horror as the sky above them darkens with the silhouette of massive wings. A roar reverberates through the streets, shaking windows and scattering birds. Panic grips the square as people scream and flee, dropping goods and overturning carts in their desperate scramble to escape.

Volcathar, consumed with rage, swoops down from the clouds. His wings create gusts of wind that scatter loose items across the square. The party, caught off guard, has only moments to react. Before they can even raise their weapons or cast their first spells, Volcathar releases a blast of fire from his maw, engulfing the nearest market stalls and setting the square ablaze.

The smell of burning wood and flesh fills the air. Volcathar lands with a crash in the middle of the square with his eyes fixed on the party.

"Did you think you could hide from me, mortals? Now, you will burn!"

Dragon's Tactics

Surprise Attack from Above: Volcathar spots the party from the air and strikes without warning. His initial attack is a blast of flame to scatter and intimidate them, aiming to create chaos and separate the group.

Targeting Vulnerable Party Members: Volcathar focuses on party members that are out in the open first. He will aim for spellcasters or healers, seeing them as a potential threat to his power.

Flame Breath to Burn Buildings: If two or more adventurers enter a building to take cover, Volcathar will immediately shift his focus to that structure. He will unleash his breath upon the building, setting it ablaze with the intention of trapping or forcing the adventurers out. Everyone inside the building must make a Dexterity saving throw with advantage, taking only half damage on a success. In [[/roll 1d4]] rounds, the building collapses.

Town Guards: If the town guard starts to gather, Volcathar may retreat to avoid an overwhelming counterattack.

If the Party Flees: If most of the party flees, Volcathar laughs cruelly.

“Flee, cowards! You can run all you want, but my flames will find you again!”

He watches them scatter before setting a final building ablaze and soaring away into the sky, leaving the town square in ruins.

Lava Fall

This map can be used if the previous lair was destroyed by the party actions during their first encounter with Volcathar. Now, having tracked the dragon back to his domain, the adventurers find a dark, rocky plateau rising above a surrounding river of molten lava.

Furious at their daring intrusion, Volcathar prepares to make his final stand. This plateau is all that remains of his sanctuary, and seeing the adventurers invade it fills him with rage. Here, encircled by the river of lava, the dragon plans to fight to the death, determined to turn his enemies into ashes.

The Obsidian Sentinel is an encounter set within a volcanic mountain, where a powerful forge lies hidden. This forge, built by an ancient clan of dwarves, harnesses the mountain's molten core to fuel its mystical creations. You can expect a richly detailed environment filled with dynamic and automated creatures that bring the battle to life.

Within the Obsidian Forge, players will face the Obsidian Sentinel, a guardian crafted from dark, volcanic glass. The Sentinel is protected and enhanced by three magical shards that provide critical buffs, making it a challenging adversary.

As a reward for their efforts, players who defeat the Obsidian Sentinel can claim its magic set: the Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar and Shield. These magic items offer unique abilities when wielded together.

All creatures and magic items in this encounter have fully automated abilities and animations, ensuring a seamless and engaging experience. The tokens are animated, adding a visual flair that enhances the immersion. A comprehensive journal is included, providing the Game Master with all the necessary lore, descriptions, and tactical information to run the encounter smoothly. The Obsidian Sentinel offers an exciting and challenging boss battle with a blend of tactical combat and immersive animations, ensuring a memorable experience for both the Game Master and players.

LORE.name: LORE
LORE.text: The Obsidian Forge was created thousands of years ago by a powerful clan of dwarves, renowned for their mastery of both metallurgy and magic. They built the forge deep within the heart of a volcanic mountain, harnessing the mountain's molten core to fuel their creations. This forge was designed to craft weapons that instill fear and dread in all who opposed them, capable of influencing the fate of entire kingdoms. To protect their greatest secrets and creations, the dwarves forged the Obsidian Sentinel, an eternal guardian that stands ever vigilant against intruders.

OBSIDIAN SENTINEL

Armor Class: 13 (Natural Armor)

Hit Points: 65 (10d8 + 20)

Speed: Hover 30 ft.

Attributes:

  • Strength: 12 (+1)
  • Dexterity: 16 (+3)
  • Constitution: 14 (+2)
  • Intelligence: 6 (-2)
  • Wisdom: 10 (+0)
  • Charisma: 6 (-2)

Senses: Darkvision 60ft

Languages: Understands Common but can't speak

Damage Immunities: Poison, Psychic

Condition Immunities: Bleeding, Blinded, Charmed, Cursed, Deafened, Diseased, Exhaustion, Frightened, Incapacitated, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Prone, Stunned, Transformed, Unconscious

Challenge: 3 (700 XP)

Appearance: The Sentinel is composed from dark, volcanic glass. The surface of its body is layered with sharp, angular plates, resembling a natural armor formed by the solidified lava.

At the center of its chest, a blazing core of molten lava can be seen, glowing with intense light. This core radiates heat and seems to pulse with the energy that powers the Sentinel, while it hovers above the ground, propelled by a constant jet of fiery energy emanating from its lower torso.

The Sentinel's head is crowned with a helmet-like structure, with a pair of glowing eyes that shine with the same intensity as its core. The eyes seem to pierce through the darkness, constantly vigilant and ready to detect any intruders.

Actions

  1. Multiattack. The Obsidian Sentinel makes two melee attacks.

Features

  1. Magic Resistance. The Obsidian Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

  2. Obsidian Grip. The Sentinel cannot be disarmed by any means, including spells or abilities that would force it to drop its weapon.

REWARDS.name: REWARDS
REWARDS.text: The primary treasures are the Sentinel’s scimitar and shield.

ADVENTURE HOOK.name: ADVENTURE HOOK
ADVENTURE HOOK.text:
The Scholar's Request: An eccentric scholar believes the Obsidian Forge contains ancient texts and blueprints detailing forgotten technologies. They offer a substantial reward for any documents or artifacts the adventurers can recover.

The Dragon's Hoard: A dragon's hoard, believed to be hidden in the depths of the Obsidian Forge, has attracted the attention of both the adventurers and dragon hunters.

The Rival Adventurers: A rival group of adventurers has entered the Obsidian Forge, seeking glory and riches. However, they haven't returned. Their guild hires the players to find out what happened and, if necessary, complete the rival group's mission.

The Missing Smith: A renowned blacksmith has gone missing after seeking out the legendary Obsidian Forge, hoping to craft a weapon of unparalleled power. The adventurers are hired by the blacksmith's apprentice to find and rescue their master.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
1. You can safely rename Obsidian Sentinel NPC or the Shards.

  2. Shard abilities can be used multiple times. For example, if the encounter is too easy, the shards can use their abilities on each other.

  3. The Obsidian Sentinel is already equipped with the Scimitar and Shield, but to gain the Dreadful Protector ability, you must unequip and re-equip either the sword or the shield after the Obsidian Sentinel has been placed on the scene.

  4. When a shard is destroyed, its active buff (if any) and its canvas animation are terminated.

  5. The easiest way to clear a buff is to delete it's corresponding shard.

  6. If the Shard of Vitality it's used multiple times on the same target then it will keep adding temporary HP on every usage up to 150. Shard of Power and Shard of Protection buffs won't stack if they are used multiple times.

  7. It is possible to have multiple shards of the same type on the canvas. In this case the buffs from the shards will stack.

Important: Do not place more than one ability on a shard.

Volcathar Ascension.name: Volcathar Ascension
Volcathar Ascension.description:
Rumors are spreading through the trading village, where fear has taken root. People are barring their doors and traveling only in groups, for those who venture out alone never return. Whispers of shadows in the night and an unnamed terror have seized the hearts of the villagers. Friends, family, and even passing travelers have mysteriously vanished without a trace, leaving the community gripped by dread as the disappearances continue.

A fanatical cult, hidden in the nearby mountains, is to blame for the disappearances. Led by Father Korvan, the cult worships a young red dragon named Volcathar the Flameborn. They believe that through worship and sacrificial offerings, can bind the dragon to their will. Unknown to them, Volkathar only pretends to be controlled, fully aware of the cultist’s intentions. Knowing that the ritual will transform him into an adult dragon, he tolerates the cult’s presence. A group of adventurers are hired to investigate the disappearances. Can they traverse the treacherous terrain, rescue the captives, and stop the cult before Volcathar's power becomes unstoppable?

The clock is ticking, and every step they take brings them closer to confronting a danger far greater than they could ever have imagined.

Armor Class: 18 (Natural Armor)

  • Strength: 23 (+6)

  • Wisdom: 11 (+0)
  • Charisma: 19 (+4)

Senses: Blindsight 30 ft., Darkvision 120 ft

Languages: Common, Draconic

Damage Immunities: Fire

Challenge: 10 (5900 XP)

Appearance: Volcathar the Flameborn is an imposing dragon with dark red scales and black-edged wings. His powerful tail ends in sharp, jagged spikes.

Actions

  1. Multiattack. The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

  2. Bite. Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

  3. Claw. Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

  4. Fire Breath. The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Volcathar the Flameborn Quotes

During the Ritual Encounter:

  1. "Remember this moment of desperation as you face me again. The flames of our next encounter will be far more intense!"

  2. "What’s the matter? Are you afraid of a little heat?"

  3. "I’m here to make sure you roast slowly before the real battle begins!"

In the Lair:

  1. “Welcome to the inferno! I trust you find my domain… welcoming?”
  2. “The lava beneath your feet will be your grave.”
  3. “You will know the true meaning of suffering before I end your pitiful existence!”
  4. “Ah, the sweet aroma of burning flesh. It is a scent I intend to enjoy thoroughly.”

When Minions are Defeated:

  1. “These weaklings thought they could bring glory to my name. They die as they lived—worthless!”

When Severely Injurend or on the Defense:

  1. “You think you’ve won? I am a dragon! Your victory is but a temporary illusion!”

Before or After the Final Confruntation:

  1. “I have ruled the flames for ages, and I shall continue to do so, even if it means burning the world to cinders!”
  2. “The gods themselves fear my power. What chance do mere mortals have against me?”
  3. “You think yourselves heroes? How laughable. I will turn your valor to ashes and your ambitions to cinders.”

Taunts and Mockery:

  1. "Is that all you've got? I've roasted meat more resilient than your pathetic attempts!"
  2. “Your defiance is amusing. Let me show you why dragons are to be feared!”

When Defeated:

  1. “So, you have bested me... for now.”

Magma Rock (Optional Rules)

Recently Cooled Lava (Still Hot):

  • Magma rock that's only recently cooled but still extremely hot can deal 1d10 fire damage per round to creatures walking on it due to the residual heat. This could be described as a smoldering, cracked surface with glowing embers between the cracks.

  • If you want to add some danger to it, creatures walking on it could make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw to avoid stepping on particularly unstable or extra-hot spots. On a failed save, they take an additional 2d10 fire damage as they step on a superheated spot that cracks open or releases steam.

Stable Magma Rock (Cooled, but not Dangerous):

  • If the magma rock has fully cooled and solidified, it’s safe to walk on without any fire damage. However, depending on the terrain, the rock might be rough, jagged, or uneven, potentially requiring a DC 10 Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) check to avoid falling or slipping, especially if running or during combat.

Lava (Optional Rules)

Touching Lava (brief contact):

  • If a creature touches lava briefly (e.g., a hand or foot grazes it), they take 10d10 fire damage. This would represent a quick contact or splash of lava.

Falling into Lava (submerged):

  • If a creature falls into lava or is otherwise fully submerged, they take 18d10 fire damage per round they remain in the lava. This represents the intense heat and destructive power of molten rock.

Standing Near Lava:

  • The heat from nearby lava can also cause damage to those who get too close. Creatures standing within 5 feet of lava should take 1d10 fire damage at the start of their turn due to the extreme heat.

BACKGROUND.name: BACKGROUND
BACKGROUND.text:
Rumors are spreading through the trading village, where fear has taken root. People are barring their doors and traveling only in groups, for those who venture out alone never return. Whispers of shadows in the night and an unnamed terror have seized the hearts of the villagers. Friends, family, and even passing travelers have mysteriously vanished without a trace, leaving the community gripped by dread as the disappearances continue.

A fanatical cult, hidden in the nearby mountains, is to blame for the disappearances. Led by Father Korvan, the cult worships a young red dragon named Volcathar the Flameborn. They believe that through worship and sacrificial offerings, they can bind the dragon to their will. Unknown to them, Volcathar only pretends to be controlled, fully aware of the cultists intentions. Knowing that the ritual will transform him into an adult dragon, he tolerates the cult’s presence.

The Vow of the Burning Flesh

The cult’s strictest commandment is the Vow of the Burning Flesh, an oath that forbids the use of weapons. Every initiate, with the help of their fellow cultists, must capture and offer a victim as part of their initiation. The cultists believe that true power comes from within and that weapons are for the weak, for only those who rely on their own strength are deemed worthy of channeling Volcathar’s flames. They aim to reflect the might of the dragon, who needs no mortal weapons to instill terror. At the heart of their combat style and ritual practice are the Bracers of Ignition, magical items crafted from Volcathar's scales. These bracers are gifted to each cultist after they take the Vow of the Burning Flesh. They see the flames that erupt from their bracers as a sign that the dragon’s magic flows through them.

SYNOPSIS.name: SYNOPSIS
SYNOPSIS.text:
Wasteland Encounter

Traveling toward the mountain, they come across a group of cultists herding prisoners to their hideout. After a confrontation, whether through combat, persuasion, intimidation, the adventurers manage to extract crucial information from the cultists. They learn of two key locations: the lair where the cult operates, and a site known as the Toothmaw Cliffs, where an ancient ritual is currently being performed.

At this point, the party faces two choices. They can either head to the cult’s lair to uncover its secrets and potentially rescue more prisoners, or they can rush to the Toothmaw Cliffs to interrupt the ancient ritual before it’s completed.

Ritual Site

If the party decides to journey to the Toothmaw Cliffs, they will face one of two major scenarios.

  1. Scenario 1:

    If they successfully disrupt the ceremony, the dragon will remain in his younger form. Weakened by the interrupted ritual, Volcathar will fight briefly, engaging the party for a round or two before retreating to his lair. Enraged and humiliated, he commands his cultists and Father Korvan to kill the intruders. Korvan, still deluded into thinking he can control the dragon, may also flee to the lair in desperation.

    Arriving at the lair, the party will find Volcathar in a foul mood, devouring the last prisoner while Korvan grovels for mercy. When the dragon sees the party intruding into his domain, his anger flares, and he orders Korvan to deal with the intruders. With his plans shattered and his pride wounded, this is the party’s best chance to defeat the dragon. If they can creatively taunt or lure him into fighting in the open, they stand a chance of slaying the young red dragon.

  2. Scenario 2:

    If the party does not disrupt the ritual, Volcathar successfully transforms into an adult dragon. However, weakened by the rapid transformation, he retreats to his lair, leaving the cultists to engage the adventurers. Korvan will also attempt to flee to the lair.

    • Outcome 1:

      If the cult leader manages to escape, the party can follow him there.

      Reaching the lair, the party will overhear a brief exchange between Korvan and the dragon. Still deluded, Korvan believes he can control Volcathar, but the dragon, amused by the cult leader’s arrogance, mocks him before incinerating him in a flash of fire. If the party chooses to engage the dragon and wounds him too severely, he will submerge into the lava, swearing revenge once he fully recovers.

      Volcathar will require 1d6 + 6 months of sleep to fully complete his transformation. Should the party touch his hoard, the dragon’s wrath will trigger a magical collapse of the cavern, and they will only have a few minutes to escape before being buried alive.

    • Outcome 2:

      If Korvan does not manage to escape.

      Reaching the lair, the dragon will remain hidden until they discover his hoard. Once they do, Volcathar will either engage them in battle or attempt to bargain. If he chooses to fight, his abilities remain the same as before, though his size has increased due to the ritual. Despite this, he still requires 1d6 + 6 months of sleep to fully complete his transformation.

      If the battle turns against him and he is critically wounded, Volcathar will retreat into the lava, swearing to hunt the party until the end of time. Should the players attempt to steal from his hoard, the cavern will violently tremble, causing the lava to rise. They will have only a few minutes to escape before the lair collapses.

Dragon Lair

If the party goes straight to the lair.

When the party enters the lair, they find it mostly empty, with only one prisoner held captive. As they explore further, they discover murals in the Great Hallway that illustrate the dragon’s plan to reach adulthood through a sacrificial ritual. At this point, the dragon will arrive in the lair from the ritual site in its adult form, though still weakened by the ritual. It will retain the same abilities and stats as its younger form. He needs 1d6 + 6 months of sleep to fully complete its transformation.

Initially, the dragon will engage in combat for a few rounds. However, having achieved his goal, he will begin to bargain with the players. He will offer a deal: he will not attack the nearby village and will retreat to sleep for an extended period if they bring him the heads of the cultists and their leader, Korvan, who tried to control him for his own ends. Just as the dragon makes his offer, Korvan and his cultists will arrive at the lair, prompting the dragon to say:

Volcathar: "The betrayers arrive just as I expected. Punish them in my name and I shall reward your deed."

MAPS.name: MAPS
MAPS.text:

Intro

In the dark volcanic wasteland, the party encounters 4 cultists escorting 2 prisoners. The cultists, fanatical and aggressive, immediately attack, shouting:

The party can use Persuade DC 14 to extract information. The surviving cultist responds cryptically, his gaze fixed on a distant glowing red light. He says:

  • Note: Refers to the lair: "Return to the nest before the god is truly born. The lost in chains must be ready for the final sacrifice."

The prisoners might mention overhearing conversations among the cultists about "awakening the flame that will devour the skies." The party might notice a strange red glow pulsing on the distant horizon.

Toothmaw Cliffs

Intro

In the center of the map is a red fire vortex, spinning with intense heat. Anyone within 25ft of the center of the vortex must make a Constitution DC 14 saving throw or take [[/roll 2d6]] fire damage at the start of their turn. Surrounding the vortex are sharp, rocky spires that rise up to 20ft in height, resembling the fangs of some enormous creature. Players can climb or descend these spires, but if they want to jump, they need to succeed on a DC 12 Acrobatics check.

The party arrives just in time to witness a dark ritual in progress. Father Korvan and five cultists are preparing to throw prisoners into the vortex to fuel the ritual. Five other cultists stand guard. The young red dragon Volcathar circles in the center of the vortex, surrounded by flames, waiting for his transformation into an adult dragon to be completed.

Tactical Information

Every round, a cultist throws a prisoner into the vortex.The GM may choose to have Volcathar unleash his fire breath at this moment.

If 3 prisoners are sacrificed, the ritual will be complete, and Volcathar will transform into an adult dragon.

Once transformed, the adult dragon will fight for 1-2 rounds but weakened by the transformation, he retreats to his lair.

The party can attempt to stop the ritual by attacking, imobilizing or killing the cultists or the prisoners.

If the ritual fails, Volcathar will join the fight for 2 rounds before retreating to his lair weakened by the incomplete ritual.

Depending on the party's power level, the GM can adjust the timing of the sacrifices to 2 or 3 rounds between each prisoner being thrown into the vortex to maintain an appropriate level of challenge.

Volcathar canot engage the party until the ritual either succeeds or is disrupted.

The cultists are fanatically focused on their task of throwing prisoners into the vortex, and only if directly threatened will they stop their actions to defend themselves.

After the ritual is complete or intrerrupted, Korvan will fight but eventually will try to flee to the lair beleaving that the dragon is under his control.

Flavor Dialogue

Father Korvan (in the middle of the ritual): "Witness the flames that will birth a god!"

Father Korvan (in the middle of the ritual): "Volcathar’s ascension is upon us! No one can stop the Flameborn!"

Dragon Lair

If the party skip the Ritual Site and goes straight to the lair

When the party enters the lair, they find it mostly empty, with only one prisoner held captive. As they explore further, they discover murals in the Great Hallway. A successful Religion DC 15 check reveals the dragon’s plan to reach adulthood through a sacrificial ritual. At this point, the dragon will arrive in the lair from the ritual site in its adult form, though still weakened by the ritual. It will retain the same abilities and stats as its younger form. He needs [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete its transformation.

Initially, the dragon will engage in combat for a few rounds. However, having achieved his goal, he will begin to bargain with the players. He will offer a deal: he will not attack the nearby village and will retreat to sleep for an extended period if they bring him the heads of the cultists and their leader, Korvan, who tried to control him for his own ends. Just as the dragon makes his offer, Korvan and his cultists will arrive at the lair, prompting the dragon to say:

If the party accepts the deal:

  • They will engage in battle against Korvan and his cultists, with the dragon observing. After Korvan is defeated, Volcathar will honor his bargain. He will retreat to his slumber, telling the party to leave immediately and warning them not to test his patience again.

If the party refuses the deal:

  • Volcathar will mockingly turn to Korvan, asking if he seeks mercy and offering him the chance to kill the party. Korvan, still believing he can control the dragon, will submit to the command.

Should the players attempt to steal from his hoard, the cavern will violently tremble, causing the lava to rise. They will have only a few minutes to escape before the lair collapses.

If the party disrupted the Ritual Site at Toothmaw Cliffs

At the lair, the party will find Volcathar in a foul mood, devouring the last prisoner while Korvan grovels for mercy. When the dragon sees the party intruding into his domain, his anger flares, and he orders Korvan to deal with the intruders. If they can creatively taunt or lure him into fighting in the open, they stand a chance of slaying the young red dragon.

If the party kills Volcathar and Father Korvan, they can loot the dragon’s hoard.

If the party does not disrupted the Ritual Site at Toothmaw Cliffs

If the party does not disrupt the ritual, Volcathar successfully transforms into an adult dragon. However, weakened by the rapid transformation, he retreats to his lair, leaving the cultists to engage the adventurers. Korvan will also attempt to flee to the lair.

Outcome 1:

If the cult leader manages to escape, the party can follow him there.

Reaching the lair, the party will overhear a brief exchange between Korvan and the dragon:

Volcathar: “Foolish mortal, you think you can chain a storm of fire? Your arrogance blinds you. Witness the true cost of defying me.”

Still deluded, Korvan believes he can control Volcathar, but the dragon, amused by the cult leader’s arrogance, mocks him before incinerating him with dragon fire.

If the party chooses to engage the dragon and wounds him too severely, he will submerge into the lava, swearing revenge once he fully recovers.

Volcathar will require [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete his transformation. Should the party touch his hoard, the dragon’s wrath will trigger a magical collapse of the cavern, and they will only have a few minutes to escape before being buried alive.

Outcome 2:

If Korvan does not manage to escape.

Reaching the lair, the dragon will remain hidden until they discover his hoard. Once they do, Volcathar will either engage them in battle or attempt to bargain. If he chooses to fight, his abilities remain the same as before, though his size has increased due to the ritual. Despite this, he still requires [[/roll 1d6 + 6]] months of sleep to fully complete his transformation.

If the battle turns against him and he is critically wounded, Volcathar will retreat into the lava, swearing to hunt the party until the end of time. Should the players attempt to steal from his hoard, the cavern will violently tremble, causing the lava to rise. They will have only a few minutes to escape before the lair collapses.

ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
As the adventurers trek through the snowy wilderness, they hear crashing footsteps and ragged gasps. A man stumbles into view, soaked to the bone, his hands trembling as he clutches a broken oar.

“Help! It... it destroyed my boat! A monster, it’s searching for something! Please, stop it!”

The man, is a merchant who was ambushed by the creature while navigating the river. He narrowly escaped as the abomination destroyed his boat, muttering about “the relic” and “a memory stolen by the frost.”

MAPS.name: MAPS
MAPS.text:
Snowy River

When the adventurers approach the scene of the wreckage, they see the creature's large, malformed form moves with surprising speed as it rummages through the wreckage. However, it does not immediately notice the adventurers. A Stealth (DC 14) check allows them to observe its frantic searching. It seems to be looking for objects of valor, items it believes are worthy of the dragon egg, as though it is trying to appease the egg or something within it.

If the party’s presence is detected, the Giant Abomination immediately turns to face them.

What... what is this? More treasures... for the egg!

At 20 HP or fewer, the creature flees, retreating toward its cave.

Tactics & Hazzards

The water is considered difficult terrain. Any creature that falls into the river must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw to avoid being swept 10ft downstream.

The abomination uses Frost Trail to create icy patches along the riverbank, forcing creatures into the water.

It begins combat with Frost Missile, targeting groups of enemies.

Abomination Cave

After following the Giant Abomination to its lair, the adventurers find themselves in this icy cavern. The cold is immediately noticeable, and their breath hangs in the air as mist. The darkness is interrupted by a faint glow emanating from deeper inside. The cold light reflects off the icy walls, casting ghostly shadows and faintly illuminating the path forward. Snow crunches beneath their feet as they step into the open central area. The source of the glow becomes clear as the adventurers proceed: the white dragon egg resting in an alcove, glowing faintly.

The Giant Abomination is hunched over a pile of broken wood and debris. Its grotesque form is illuminated faintly by the egg’s glow. He suddenly halts as it senses the adventurers’ approach. With an enraged, guttural cry, it lurches forward, saying:

“You’ve come to steal the treasure! I’ll rip it from your corpses!”

When the Abomination is reduced to half its HP, it retreats to the egg chamber and lets out a desperate, guttural howl:

“No! The treasure must not fall to you! The dragon commands it!”

Tactics & Hazzards

At the start of its turn, the Frost Explosion deals cold damage to all creatures within 10 feet of it.

The Abomination makes two melee attacks with its Shiverstrike, focusing on whoever seems to be carrying the heaviest gear or magical items, as it views these as valuable.

The snowy cavern floor counts as difficult terrain for anyone without cold adaptations.

If more than two party members group together, the Abomination targets them with a Frost Missile.

If cornered, the Abomination creates a 30-foot trail of ice to obstruct the party's movement, retreating toward the dragon egg to make a final stand.

The white dragon egg radiates a magical cold aura within 20ft. Any creature except the Giant Abomination within this radius has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

This encounter unfolds in a forgotten crypt, an unholy place where a stone bridge spans a swirling pool of lost souls. Whispers echo through the air, carrying the voices of the trapped and the damned. The Soulbound Knight, an undead warrior bound to eternal servitude, wields a spectral glaive known as The Harvester. He uses ethereal manipulation and tormented souls to protect the crypt and its dark secrets. Beyond the bridge rises a formidable mausoleum, its massive stone doors guarding the secrets within.

As a reward, the players can obtain The Harvester, the powerful weapon imbued with ethereal energy wielded by the Soulbound Knight.

LORE.name: LORE
LORE.text: Once a noble warrior, the Soulbound Knight met his tragic end in a fierce battle against a malevolent lich. Succumbing to the lich's dark sorcery, his corrupted spirit was ensnared within an imposing suit of plate armor, condemned to forever guard the forgotten crypt where the lich's phylactery lies hidden. His weapon—a glaive with a skull atop its shaft, from which the blade emerges—once belonged to the knight himself, now a macabre symbol of his eternal servitude.

BOSS.name: BOSS
BOSS.text:
SOULBOUND KNIGHT

Armor Class: 18 (Plate Armor)

Hit Points: 85 (10d8 + 40)

Speed: 30 ft.

Attributes:

  • Strength: 18 (+4)
  • Dexterity: 11(+0)
  • Constitution: 18 (+4)
  • Intelligence: 10 (0)
  • Wisdom: 12 (+1)
  • Charisma: 14 (+2)

Senses: Darkvision 60ft

Languages: The language it knew in life

Damage Immunities: Poison

Damage Resistance: Necrotic, Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing from attacks that are not magical

Damage Vulnerabilities: Radiant

Condition Immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Poisoned

Challenge: 4 (1100 XP)

Appearance: The Soulbound Knight is a fearsome undead warrior, once a mighty paladin who fell from grace. It appears as an imposing suit of full plate armor, animated by a swirling, spectral spirit visible through the visor and joints.

Actions

  1. Multiattack. The Soulbound Knight makes two melee attacks with his glaive, The Harvester.

  2. Weapon (glaive) The Harverster Abilities.

    • Dark Harvest. When striking a creature, the blade deals an additional [[/roll 1d4]] necrotic damage. If the creature dies, your next attack has advantage.

    • Phantom Strike. As an action, you can use Phantom Strike. When you hit a creature with this ability, it must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target enters an ethereal state for 1d4 rounds, existing simultaneously on both the Ethereal and Material Planes but having minimal interaction with either. The target can see both planes and see invisible creatures within a 60ft radius. Its attacks have disadvantage, it cannot pass through walls, and it is susceptible to damage from attacks in both planes. At the end of this duration, the target reappears in the Material Plane. You can use this ability once per long rest.

    • Soul Reap. Once per long rest, as an action, you can spin The Harvester releasing a burst of necrotic energy that targets all creatures within 10ft. Each creature in this area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/roll 1d10]] slashing damage plus [[/roll 1d8]] necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

  3. Spirit Call. As a bonus action, the Soulbound Knight can command two souls from the swirling pool to attack his enemies.

  4. Soul Sacrifice. As a bonus action, the Soulbound Knight can destroy one of his Soul Servants to activate Soul Rejuvenation.

Features

  1. Empowered Phantom Strike. The Soulbound Knight can use Phantom Strike again if no target is affected by etherealness.

  2. Empowered Soul Reap. This ability recharges on a roll of 5-6 on a d6.

  3. Phantom Recall. As a bonus action, the Soulbound Knight can teleport The Harvester into its hand from any location.

  4. Magic Resistance. The Soulbound Knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

  5. Ethereal Sight. The Soulbound Knight can see 60ft into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

  6. Soulbound Fortitude. If damage reduces the Soulbound Knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or a critical strike. On a success, the Soulbound Knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

The Soulbound Knight Quotes

Before the Battle:

  1. "You trespass upon sacred ground. None shall leave unscathed."
  2. "My soul is bound to this wretched place. You will join me in eternal suffering."
  3. "The lich's will commands me, and I must obey. Prepare to face oblivion."

During the Battle:

  1. "Your fate is sealed, as was mine."
  2. "You cannot escape the ethereal grasp!"
  3. "Witness the power of the Harvester!"
  4. "You will find no sanctuary here."
  5. "Your struggle is futile; my minions hunger for your soul."

When Using Phantom Strike:

  1. "Behold, the realm between life and death!"
  2. "Feel the touch of the ethereal!"
  3. "You will know the despair of the in-between."

When Healing from Soul Rejuvenation:

  1. "Your efforts are in vain; I am restored!"
  2. "The more you fight, the stronger I become!"
  3. "Their sacrifice grants me strength!"

When Using Spirit Call:

  1. "Beware the haunting of the lost!"
  2. "Their torment shall be your end!"
  3. "Face the wrath of the forsaken souls!"
  4. "The souls of the forgotten shall be your doom."
  5. "Embrace the despair of those who came before."

  1. "The darkness... it tightens its grip."
  2. "My end is near, but so is yours!"

When Defeated:

  1. "Finally... release from this torment..."
  2. "The curse... is lifted... at last."
  3. "In death... I find peace..."

LOCATION.name: LOCATION
LOCATION.text: The encounter unfolds in a vast chamber within a forgotten crypt. At its center, a stone bridge spans above a swirling pool of lost souls, whispering with the voices of the trapped and the damned. Beyond the bridge rises a formidable structure—a mausoleum with imposing stone doors that loom ominously in the chamber's gloom.

REWARDS.name: REWARDS
REWARDS.text: The primary treasure is The Harverster, the glaive of the Soulbound Knight.

ADVENTURE HOOK.name: ADVENTURE HOOK
ADVENTURE HOOK.text:
Accidental Discovery. Adventurers stumble upon a forgotten crypt, unaware that it houses the phylactery of a malevolent lich. Trapped inside, they must navigate its dangers to escape while uncovering dark secrets.

Order of Redemption. A paladin order seeks to release a fallen knight from its cursed servitude in a crypt. They recruit adventurers to face undead guardians, confront the knight, and find a way to grant it peace.

The Lich's Legacy. A map uncovered in an ancient library points to a hidden crypt rumored to hold the final resting place of a malevolent lich. Adventurers seek to locate this crypt and claim the dark artifacts and forbidden knowledge said to lie within.

The Ghostly Guardians. Villagers speak of a cursed cemetery where restless spirits roam freely. Adventurers are hired to investigate and lay these spirits to rest, unaware of the necromancer's secret agenda.

Echoes of the Past. Adventurers stumble upon a mysterious journal chronicling a heroic journey to annihilate an ancient evil that threatens the realm. The journal hints at a crypt concealed deep within a forbidding wilderness.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
1. In this encounter, the Soul Servants are invisible. The player affected by the Phantom Strike's etherealness will be able to see the invisible souls.

  2. The Necrotic Shock ability from the Soul Servant does not automatically apply disadvantage on targets that have metal armor.

  3. The Soul Rejuvenation ability from the Soul Servant will work only once. If the Soul Servant is somehow healed and it dies again, it will not trigger the Soul Rejuvenation again. Also Soul Rejuvenation will not trigger if the Soulbound Knight it's full HP.

  4. To use the Soul Sacrifice ability, target a Soul Servant and then use the ability. It will deal 6 damage to the Soul Servant, thus killing it and triggering the Soul Rejuvenation ability. If you increase the HP of the Soul Servants, you have to adjust the damage of Soul Sacrifice accordingly.

  5. You can increase the Lightning Darkness Level to at least 0.6 to create a more overwhelming feeling.

Note: The safest way to reimport the encounter is to delete the existing scene first and then import it. Otherwise, there are risks of having tokens with no reference, which cannot be controlled and have to be manually deleted from the map.

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

Example Encounter Difficulty Estimations for a CR4 Boss:

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 2 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be deadly.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 3 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be deadly.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 4 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be hard.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 5 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be medium.

The easiest way to adjust the difficulty of the encounter is by changing the hit points and armor of the monsters.

Note: If the party has radiant damage, the encounter tends to be easy for the party. To counter that, you can increase the armor or hit points of the Soulbound Knight and Soul Servants.

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. To use this item, you must equip and attune to it.

  2. This item should not be equipped by more than one player at the same time.

  3. After attunement you will get Phantom Strike (Active Ability) and Soul Reap (Active Ability) under the Features tab. To activate these abilities, simply click on their icon.

Flame Tyrant.name: Flame Tyrant
Flame Tyrant.description:
Prepare to embark on an immersive encounter for Foundry VTT as you delve into the heart of an active volcanic chamber. Here, amidst the raging fires of the inferno, the party will face the formidable Flame Tyrant and his minions, testing their mettle against the fury of the underworld.

Challenge: 1/2 (100 XP)

Appearance. A creature of fire, the Flame Elemental's head resembles a blazing torch. Its wings and limbs twist like tongues of flames. Driven by primal instinct, it roams the deserts and volcanic landscapes, drawn to areas where the flames of the earth burn brightest. Occasionally, it can be bound to the will of more powerful beings.

Flames Breath.name: Flames Breath
Flames Breath.description: Flames Breath. The Flame Elemental can breath flames to a creature within 5 ft. The creature must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.

Death Nova.name: Death Nova
Death Nova.description: Death Nova. When the Flame Elemental dies, it explodes in a burst of fire. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The Flame Tyrant CR6.name: The Flame Tyrant CR6
The Flame Tyrant CR6.description:
Armor Class: 13 (Unarmored)

Hit Points: 85 (10d8 + 40)

Speed: 30 ft.

Attributes:

  • Strength: 10 (+0)
  • Dexterity: 16 (+3)
  • Constitution: 16 (+3)
  • Intelligence: 14 (+2)
  • Wisdom: 12 (+1)
  • Charisma: 16 (+3)

Languages: Abyssal, Common, Ignan

Damage Resistance: Fire

Damage Vulnerabilities: Cold

Condition Immunities: Charmed, Frightened

Challenge: 6 (2,300 XP)

Appearance: The Flame Tyrant stands over 8 feet tall. His eyes gleam like molten gold within his skull-shaped head. He wears a crimson robe and a flowing cape, the color of dried blood, hangs from his shoulders.

The Flame Tyrant Quotes:

  1. "I am the Flame Tyrant, and my rule shall scorch the world's pages with tales of my glory!"

  2. "Fire cleanses, purifies, and destroys. You think yourselves strong enough to command it? Let us test your resolve."

  3. "Extinguish my flames? Foolish mortals. My flames are eternal, as is my dominion over them. You will burn or bow."

  4. "Negotiate? There is but one negotiation: my will or your demise. What could you possibly offer that matches the power of fire?"

  5. "My flames are eternal, my power unyielding. Bow or burn."

  6. "The inferno that courses through me cannot be tamed by mortals. I am a living testament to fire's supremacy."

  7. "Ah, the ants dare to challenge the Flame Tyrant himself. Your defiance shall be a testament to the power of the inferno!"

  8. "Knowledge, you say? Power's true nature lies in wielding it, not in understanding it. But if you seek power, then face me and prove your worth."

Inferno Wave.name: Inferno Wave
Inferno Wave.description: Inferno Wave (Recharge 5-6). As an action, the Flame Tyrant slams the ground, causing waves of intense heat to ripple outward, igniting the ground with flames that persist for 1 minute. All creatures within a 15-foot radius, as well as any creature that enters the area for the duration, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes vulnerable to fire damage for as long as it remains in the area. A creature that successfully saves is not affected by the vulnerability.

On a failed save, the target is also set ablaze, taking an additional 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

Infernal Explosion.name: Infernal Explosion
Infernal Explosion.description: Infernal Explosion (Recharge 5-6). The Flame Tyrant casts a fireball at a point he can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown.description:
Wondrous Item, very rare (requires attunement by a fighter, sorcerer, wizard, warlock or rogue)

"There is a fire inside. Watch the flames, the ancient, flickering of the relic's essence and become reborn."

The Infernal Crown, known also as the Pyro Head, is a relic forged in the heart of a extinguished volcano. The helm resembles a skull engulfed in flames.

Ember Gaze. As an action, you can unleash a gaze attack from the Pyro Head. Three rays shoot forth from the helm's eyes and mouth, targeting the nearest three creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each targeted creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 15). On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 fire damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. If a creature dies from this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage the creature took.

This ability can be use twice per long rest.

Inferno Barrier. You are immune to environmental heat damage and resistant to any fire-based attacks or spells.

Intimidating Aura. You gain a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks and a -5 penalty to Persuasion checks.

Curse. When the Infernal Crown is donned, the helm fuses with you, becoming unremovable. During this time, your head takes the appearance of a burning skull, wreathed in fire (the fire is harmless and does not emit heat and light). The helm cannot be removed as long as you live.

LORE.name: LORE
LORE.text:
It is said that a mage, fascinated by fire and convinced of its potential for ultimate power, embarked on a journey into the heart of an extinguished volcano. Within the depths of the volcano, he discovered a chamber where the boundaries between the material world and the elemental plane of fire were thin, allowing him to harness the purest form of fire magic. Over time, fascination turned to obsession for absolute power, and after extensive experiments with rare materials and ancient incantations, he created the Infernal Crown, awakening the volcano in the process.

Proclaiming himself the Flame Tyrant, he initiated a destructive conquest of the surrounding lands. Villages and towns fell before his advance, consumed by flames. Survivors, terrorized by the flames that devoured everything in their path, fled to neighboring kingdoms, spreading rumors that the volcanic eruption was not a natural occurrence, and that a creature they named "Pyro Head" was responsible for it.

Mysterious Fires. Mysterious fires have been erupting in towns and villages across the land, leaving destruction in their wake. The pattern of the fires leads the adventurers to suspect that someone is using fire magic on an unprecedented scale.

Burning Plague. A remote village is suffering from an unexplainable plague that causes the afflicted to spontaneously combust.

Fire Cult Threat. A cult devoted to fire worship has grown in power and influence, seeking to unleash an apocalypse of flames upon the world.

The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.
You can adjust the difficulty during the encounter by spawning more CR1/2 minions every round.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 5 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be medium.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 6 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be easy.

Ogre Hideout.name: Ogre Hideout
Ogre Hideout.description: In the rugged canyon, a group of adventurers seeks shelter in a large rocky overhang, only to discover it is the lair of two fearsome ogre brothers, Grom and Grak. This dynamic encounter features animated tokens, abilities, and magic items, creating an immersive and visually engaging experience. Grom wields his enchanted greatclub, the Headbutt, while Grak commands the battlefield with his bladed whip. The confined space of the overhang intensifies the challenge as the ogres coordinate their efforts to overwhelm the party. Once the ogres are defeated, the adventurers can claim their magic items, each with unique attack animations and art. A detailed journal accompanies the encounter, offering lore, tactical insights, and all necessary information to ensure a thrilling and interactive adventure.

Missing Caravan. A valuable merchant caravan has gone missing while traveling through a canyon. The merchant guild offers a substantial reward for anyone who can recover the lost goods and rescue any survivors.

The Terrorizing Ogres. The ogres have been terrorizing the nearby village, stealing livestock, destroying property, and causing general havoc. Desperate for peace, the villagers turn to the adventurers for help, promising a reward for eliminating the ogre menace.

Shelter from the Storm. Caught in a fierce storm while traversing a rugged canyon, the adventurers seek shelter under a large rocky overhang, only to discover they’ve stumbled into a hidden hideout occupied by two ogres.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
1. Ogre Brutality: This ability applies only to ogres. If you wish to disable it, simply delete the feature. The extra die is applied to the damage before evaluation. This means that if the ogre has a melee weapon that deals 1d4 damage, the final damage will be 2d4. On a critical hit, the damage will be 4d4.

  2. Punch and Throw Rock: These abilities are configurable, and the damage can be adjusted as needed.

TACTICS.name: TACTICS
TACTICS.text: Grom will charge and smash through enemy lines with his big club, while Grak uses his whip to harass and disrupt weaker foes.

LORE.name: LORE
LORE.text: Two ogre brothers, Grom and Grak, stumbled upon a large rocky overhang in a canyon during a fierce storm. Now, this secluded refuge serves as their base for raiding and terrorizing the surrounding region. Grom wields a greatclub forged from the skull of a legendary ogre warrior, whose hard head, after his demise, was bound with steel at the top of the ironwood club. Grak uses a whip taken from the last adventurers they killed.

INTRO.name: INTRO
INTRO.text:
From a distance, the adventurers can hear the brothers' voices caught in a fierce debate. They realize the argument is over a weapon of some kind.

Grom (bashing his fist into his chest): "ME has rights on big club! ME is older and bigger! Is why pops gave it, like older pops gave it to him! YOU have the whip now, so stop whining!"

Grak (snarling back): "Whip ain't good like big club! Big club crushes, big club breaks bones! Whip just stings!

Grom (smirking): "Whip good for scaring humans though. They scream loud when whip cracks. Maybe you not use it right."

Grak (irritated): "Me knows how to use whip! Me just wants real weapon, like big club. Me want to feel bones break, not just hear cries."

Grom (leans back, gesturing annoyed): "You don’t even know name of club, you too stupid, little ogre! Clan rule say oldest one gets big bad club and ME is oldest! ME will be leader and leader say big club is mine! Clan is strong with me! You dare challenge and I smack you silly like momma did when yous was small grub!"

Grak (stands back, grumbling with a sly grin): "Me grows stronger and yous grows older, brother. Me takes big club... Not today, but maybe day after. And THEN I smack you silly with big bad hard head on stick."

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. To use this item, you must equip and attune to it.

  2. Before being equipped to a Player or an NPC, the item's name can be modified. Once it has been equipped, further renaming is not advised.

  3. The item can be customized, from damage, attack bonus and Strength saving throw.

Important: There is a change in how the game sets and gets the weight and attunement of an item between D&D v3.1 and D&D v3.2 in FVTT. Since these items were created in D&D v3.2, the weight will be null and the attunement will be set to "Not Required" when the item is imported into D&D v3.1 or earlier versions. The player or GM must manually configure the weight and attunement before the items are equipped. The glave has a default weight of 6 lb. To set the attunement, go to the item sheet and select "Attunement Required."
